VoiceConnectors.documentation: The details of the Amazon Chime Voice Connectors.

LoggingConfiguration.documentation: The logging configuration associated with an Amazon Chime Voice Connector. Specifies whether SIP message logs are enabled for sending to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

EnableMediaMetricLogs.documentation: Boolean that enables the logging of Voice Connector metrics to Cloudwatch.

EnableSIPLogs.documentation: When true, enables SIP message logs for sending to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

MediaCapturePipeline.documentation: A media capture pipeline object consisting of an ID, source type, source ARN, a sink type, a sink ARN, and a configuration object.

ChimeSdkMeetingConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for a specified media capture pipeline. SourceType must be ChimeSdkMeeting.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the capture pipeline was created, in ISO 8601 format.

MediaPipelineId.documentation: The ID of a media capture pipeline.

SinkArn.documentation: ARN of the destination to which the media artifacts are saved.

SinkType.documentation: Destination type to which the media artifacts are saved. You must use an S3 Bucket.

SourceArn.documentation: ARN of the source from which the media artifacts will be saved.

SourceType.documentation: Source type from which media artifacts are saved. You must use ChimeMeeting.

Status.documentation: The status of the media capture pipeline.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the capture pipeline was updated, in ISO 8601 format.

MediaPlacement.documentation: A set of endpoints used by clients to connect to the media service group for an Amazon Chime SDK meeting.

EventIngestionUrl.documentation: The event ingestion URL to which you send client meeting events.

Meeting.documentation: A meeting created using the Amazon Chime SDK.

MediaRegion.documentation: The Region in which you create the meeting. Available values: af-south-1, ap-northeast-1, ap-northeast-2, ap-south-1, ap-southeast-1, ap-southeast-2, ca-central-1, eu-central-1, eu-north-1, eu-south-1, eu-west-1, eu-west-2, eu-west-3, sa-east-1, us-east-1, us-east-2, us-west-1, us-west-2.

MeetingNotificationConfiguration.documentation: The resource target configurations for receiving Amazon Chime SDK meeting and attendee event notifications. The Amazon Chime SDK supports resource targets located in the US East (N. Virginia) AWS Region (us-east-1).

Member.documentation: The member details, such as email address, name, member ID, and member type.

MemberId.documentation: The member ID (user ID or bot ID).

MemberError.documentation: The list of errors returned when a member action results in an error.

MembershipItem.documentation: Membership details, such as member ID and member role.

MessagingSessionEndpoint.documentation: The websocket endpoint used to connect to Amazon Chime SDK messaging.

Url.documentation: The endpoint to which you establish a websocket connection.

NotFoundException.documentation: One or more of the resources in the request does not exist in the system.

OrderedPhoneNumber.documentation: A phone number for which an order has been placed.

Origination.documentation:
Origination settings enable your SIP hosts to receive inbound calls using your Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

The parameters listed below are not required, but you must use at least one.

Disabled.documentation: When origination settings are disabled, inbound calls are not enabled for your Amazon Chime Voice Connector. This parameter is not required, but you must specify this parameter or Routes.

Routes.documentation: The call distribution properties defined for your SIP hosts. Valid range: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of 20. This parameter is not required, but you must specify this parameter or Disabled.

OriginationRoute.documentation:
Origination routes define call distribution properties for your SIP hosts to receive inbound calls using your Amazon Chime Voice Connector. Limit: Ten origination routes for each Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

The parameters listed below are not required, but you must use at least one.

Host.documentation: The FQDN or IP address to contact for origination traffic.

Port.documentation: The designated origination route port. Defaults to 5060.

Priority.documentation: The priority associated with the host, with 1 being the highest priority. Higher priority hosts are attempted first.

Protocol.documentation: The protocol to use for the origination route. Encryption-enabled Amazon Chime Voice Connectors use TCP protocol by default.

Weight.documentation: The weight associated with the host. If hosts are equal in priority, calls are redistributed among them based on their relative weight.

Participant.documentation: The phone number and proxy phone number for a participant in an Amazon Chime Voice Connector proxy session.

PhoneNumber.documentation: A phone number used for Amazon Chime Business Calling or an Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

CallingName.documentation: The outbound calling name associated with the phone number.

Country.documentation: The phone number country. Format: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The phone number creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

DeletionTimestamp.documentation: The deleted phone number timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The updated phone number timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

PhoneNumberAssociation.documentation: The phone number associations, such as Amazon Chime account ID, Amazon Chime user ID, Amazon Chime Voice Connector ID, or Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.

AssociatedTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp of the phone number association, in ISO 8601 format.

Name.documentation: Defines the association with an Amazon Chime account ID, user ID, Amazon Chime Voice Connector ID, or Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.

Value.documentation: Contains the ID for the entity specified in Name.

PhoneNumberCapabilities.documentation: The phone number capabilities for Amazon Chime Business Calling phone numbers, such as enabled inbound and outbound calling and text messaging.

InboundCall.documentation: Allows or denies inbound calling for the specified phone number.

InboundMMS.documentation: Allows or denies inbound MMS messaging for the specified phone number.

InboundSMS.documentation: Allows or denies inbound SMS messaging for the specified phone number.

OutboundCall.documentation: Allows or denies outbound calling for the specified phone number.

OutboundMMS.documentation: Allows or denies outbound MMS messaging for the specified phone number.

OutboundSMS.documentation: Allows or denies outbound SMS messaging for the specified phone number.

CountryCode.documentation: The phone number country code. Format: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

PhoneNumberError.documentation: If the phone number action fails for one or more of the phone numbers in the request, a list of the phone numbers is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

PhoneNumberId.documentation: The phone number ID for which the action failed.

PhoneNumberOrder.documentation: The details of a phone number order created for Amazon Chime.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The phone number order creation time stamp, in ISO 8601 format.

OrderedPhoneNumbers.documentation: The ordered phone number details, such as the phone number in E.164 format and the phone number status.

Status.documentation: The status of the phone number order.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The updated phone number order time stamp, in ISO 8601 format.

Proxy.documentation: The proxy configuration for an Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

DefaultSessionExpiryMinutes.documentation: The default number of minutes allowed for proxy sessions.

Disabled.documentation: When true, stops proxy sessions from being created on the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

FallBackPhoneNumber.documentation: The phone number to route calls to after a proxy session expires.

PhoneNumberCountries.documentation: The countries for proxy phone numbers to be selected from.

ProxySession.documentation: The proxy session for an Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The created time stamp, in ISO 8601 format.

EndedTimestamp.documentation: The ended time stamp, in ISO 8601 format.

ExpiryMinutes.documentation: The number of minutes allowed for the proxy session.

GeoMatchLevel.documentation: The preference for matching the country or area code of the proxy phone number with that of the first participant.

GeoMatchParams.documentation: The country and area code for the proxy phone number.

NumberSelectionBehavior.documentation: The preference for proxy phone number reuse, or stickiness, between the same participants across sessions.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The updated time stamp, in ISO 8601 format.

AppInstanceRetentionSettings.documentation: The time in days to retain data. Data type: number.
The time in days to retain data. Data type: number.

InitiateDeletionTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the API deletes data.

LambdaFunctionArn.documentation: Lambda function ARN that allows the bot to receive outgoing events.

InitiateDeletionTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp representing the time at which the specified items are permanently deleted, in ISO 8601 format.

DefaultSessionExpiryMinutes.documentation: The default number of minutes allowed for proxy sessions.

Disabled.documentation: When true, stops proxy sessions from being created on the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

FallBackPhoneNumber.documentation: The phone number to route calls to after a proxy session expires.

PhoneNumberPoolCountries.documentation: The countries for proxy phone numbers to be selected from.

ChannelArn.documentation: The ARN of the channel containing the messages that you want to redact.

MessageId.documentation: The ID of the message being redacted.

User.documentation: The user details and new personal meeting PIN.

RetentionSettings.documentation: The retention settings for an Amazon Chime Enterprise account that determine how long to retain items such as chat-room messages and chat-conversation messages.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The room creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The room update timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

InvitedBy.documentation: The identifier of the user that invited the room member.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The room membership update timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

RoomRetentionSettings.documentation: The retention settings that determine how long to retain chat-room messages for an Amazon Chime Enterprise account.

RetentionDays.documentation: The number of days for which to retain chat-room messages.

AreaCode.documentation: The area code used to filter results. Only applies to the US.

City.documentation: The city used to filter results. Only applies to the US.

Country.documentation: The country used to filter results. Defaults to the US Format: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call.

NextToken.documentation: The token used to retrieve the next page of results.

PhoneNumberType.documentation: The phone number type used to filter results. Required for non-US numbers.

State.documentation: The state used to filter results. Required only if you provide City. Only applies to the US.

TollFreePrefix.documentation: The toll-free prefix that you use to filter results. Only applies to the US.

E164PhoneNumbers.documentation: List of phone numbers, in E.164 format.

NextToken.documentation: The token used to retrieve the next page of search results.

SelectedVideoStreams.documentation: The video streams to capture for a specified media capture pipeline. The total number of video streams can't exceed 25.

AttendeeIds.documentation: The attendee IDs of the streams selected for a media capture pipeline.

ExternalUserIds.documentation: The external user IDs of the streams selected for a media capture pipeline.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

Persistence.documentation: Boolean that controls whether the message is persisted on the back end. Required.

MessageId.documentation: The ID string assigned to each message.

SigninDelegateGroup.documentation: An Active Directory (AD) group whose members are granted permission to act as delegates.

SipMediaApplication.documentation: The details of the SIP media application, including name and endpoints. An AWS account can have multiple SIP media applications.

AwsRegion.documentation: The AWS Region in which the SIP media application is created.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The SIP media application creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

Endpoints.documentation: List of endpoints for SIP media application. Currently, only one endpoint per SIP media application is permitted.

Name.documentation: The name of the SIP media application.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The SIP media application updated timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

SipMediaApplicationCall.documentation: A Call instance for a SIP media application.

SipMediaApplicationEndpoint.documentation: The endpoint assigned to the SIP media application.

LambdaArn.documentation: Valid Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function. The function must be created in the same AWS Region as the SIP media application.

SipMediaApplicationLoggingConfiguration.documentation: Logging configuration of the SIP media application.

EnableSipMediaApplicationMessageLogs.documentation: Enables application message logs for the SIP media application.

SipRule.documentation: The SIP rule details, including name, triggers, and target applications. An AWS account can have multiple SIP rules.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the SIP rule was created, in ISO 8601 format.

Disabled.documentation: Indicates whether the SIP rule is enabled or disabled. You must disable a rule before you can delete it.

TargetApplications.documentation: Target SIP media application and other details, such as priority and AWS Region, to be specified in the SIP rule. Only one SIP rule per AWS Region can be provided.

TriggerType.documentation: The type of trigger assigned to the SIP rule in TriggerValue, currently RequestUriHostname or ToPhoneNumber.

TriggerValue.documentation: If TriggerType is RequestUriHostname, then the value can be the outbound host name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector. If TriggerType is ToPhoneNumber, then the value can be a customer-owned phone number in E164 format. SipRule is triggered when a SIP rule requests host name or ToPhoneNumber matches in the incoming SIP request.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the SIP rule was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

SipRuleTargetApplication.documentation: Target SIP media application and other details, such as priority and AWS Region, to be specified in the SIP rule. Only one SIP rule per AWS Region can be provided.

AwsRegion.documentation: The AWS Region of the target application.

Priority.documentation: Priority of the SIP media application in the target list.

SourceConfiguration.documentation: Source configuration for a specified media capture pipeline.

SelectedVideoStreams.documentation: The selected video streams to capture for a specified media capture pipeline. The number of video streams can't exceed 25.

MeetingId.documentation: The unique ID of the meeting being transcribed.

TranscriptionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for the current transcription operation. Must contain EngineTranscribeSettings or EngineTranscribeMedicalSettings.

MeetingId.documentation: The unique ID of the meeting for which you stop transcription.

StreamingConfiguration.documentation: The streaming configuration associated with an Amazon Chime Voice Connector. Specifies whether media streaming is enabled for sending to Amazon Kinesis, and shows the retention period for the Amazon Kinesis data, in hours.

DataRetentionInHours.documentation: The retention period, in hours, for the Amazon Kinesis data.

Disabled.documentation: When true, media streaming to Amazon Kinesis is turned off.

StreamingNotificationTarget.documentation: The targeted recipient for a streaming configuration notification.

Tag.documentation: Describes a tag applied to a resource.

TelephonySettings.documentation: Settings that allow management of telephony permissions for an Amazon Chime user, such as inbound and outbound calling and text messaging.

Termination.documentation: Termination settings enable your SIP hosts to make outbound calls using your Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

CallingRegions.documentation: The countries to which calls are allowed, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format. Required.

CidrAllowedList.documentation: The IP addresses allowed to make calls, in CIDR format. Required.

CpsLimit.documentation: The limit on calls per second. Max value based on account service quota. Default value of 1.

Disabled.documentation: When termination settings are disabled, outbound calls can not be made.

TerminationHealth.documentation: The termination health details, including the source IP address and timestamp of the last successful SIP OPTIONS message from your SIP infrastructure.

ThrottledClientException.documentation: The client exceeded its request rate limit.

TranscriptionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for the current transcription operation. Must contain EngineTranscribeSettings or EngineTranscribeMedicalSettings.

EngineTranscribeMedicalSettings.documentation: The transcription configuration settings passed to Amazon Transcribe Medical.

EngineTranscribeSettings.documentation: The transcription configuration settings passed to Amazon Transcribe.

UnauthorizedClientException.documentation: The client is not currently authorized to make the request.

UnprocessableEntityException.documentation: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

DefaultLicense.documentation: The default license applied when you add users to an Amazon Chime account.

Name.documentation: The new name for the specified Amazon Chime account.

AccountSettings.documentation: The Amazon Chime account settings to update.

Metadata.documentation: The metadata that you want to change.

Name.documentation: The name that you want to change.

Disabled.documentation: When true, stops the specified bot from running in your account.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

Content.documentation: The content of the message being updated.

MessageId.documentation: The ID string of the message being updated.

Metadata.documentation: The metadata of the message being updated.

MessageId.documentation: The ID string of the message being updated.

ChimeBearer.documentation: The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.
The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

CallingName.documentation: The outbound calling name associated with the phone number.

UpdatePhoneNumberRequestItem.documentation: The phone number ID, product type, or calling name fields to update, used with the BatchUpdatePhoneNumber and UpdatePhoneNumber actions.

CallingName.documentation: The default outbound calling name for the account.

ExpiryMinutes.documentation: The number of minutes allowed for the proxy session.

Arguments.documentation: Arguments made available to the Lambda function as part of the CALL_UPDATE_REQUESTED event. Can contain 0-20 key-value pairs.

SipMediaApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the SIP media application handling the call.

Endpoints.documentation: The new set of endpoints for the specified SIP media application.

Name.documentation: The new name for the specified SIP media application.

Disabled.documentation: The new value specified to indicate whether the rule is disabled.

Name.documentation: The new name for the specified SIP rule.

TargetApplications.documentation: The new value of the list of target applications.

LicenseType.documentation: The user license type to update. This must be a supported license type for the Amazon Chime account that the user belongs to.

UpdateUserRequestItem.documentation: The user ID and user fields to update, used with the BatchUpdateUser action.

Name.documentation: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.

VoiceConnectorGroupId.documentation: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.

VoiceConnectorGroup.documentation: The updated Amazon Chime Voice Connector group details.

Name.documentation: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

RequireEncryption.documentation: When enabled, requires encryption for the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

VoiceConnector.documentation: The updated Amazon Chime Voice Connector details.

User.documentation: The user on the Amazon Chime account.

InvitedOn.documentation: Date and time when the user is invited to the Amazon Chime account, in ISO 8601 format.

PrimaryEmail.documentation: The primary email address of the user.

PrimaryProvisionedNumber.documentation: The primary phone number associated with the user.

RegisteredOn.documentation: Date and time when the user is registered, in ISO 8601 format.

UserError.documentation: The list of errors returned when errors are encountered during the BatchSuspendUser, BatchUnsuspendUser, or BatchUpdateUser actions. This includes user IDs, error codes, and error messages.

UserId.documentation: The user ID for which the action failed.

UserSettings.documentation: Settings associated with an Amazon Chime user, including inbound and outbound calling and text messaging.

Telephony.documentation: The telephony settings associated with the user.

StreetInfo.documentation: The address street information, such as 8th Avenue.

StreetNumber.documentation: The address street number, such as 200 or 2121.

ValidationResult.documentation: Number indicating the result of address validation. 0 means the address was perfect as is and successfully validated. 1 means the address was corrected. 2 means the address sent was not close enough and was not validated.

MuxType.documentation: The MUX type of the video artifact configuration object.

State.documentation: Indicates whether the video artifact is enabled or disabled.

VoiceConnector.documentation: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector configuration, including outbound host name and encryption settings.

AwsRegion.documentation: The AWS Region in which the Amazon Chime Voice Connector is created. Default: us-east-1.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

Name.documentation: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

OutboundHostName.documentation: The outbound host name for the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

RequireEncryption.documentation: Designates whether encryption is required for the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The updated Amazon Chime Voice Connector timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

VoiceConnectorArn.documentation: The ARN of the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

VoiceConnectorGroup.documentation: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group configuration, including associated Amazon Chime Voice Connectors. You can include Amazon Chime Voice Connectors from different AWS Regions in your group. This creates a fault tolerant mechanism for fallback in case of availability events.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group creation time stamp, in ISO 8601 format.

Name.documentation: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.

UpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The updated Amazon Chime Voice Connector group time stamp, in ISO 8601 format.

VoiceConnectorGroupArn.documentation: The ARN of the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.

VoiceConnectorGroupId.documentation: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.

VoiceConnectorItems.documentation: The Amazon Chime Voice Connectors to which to route inbound calls.

VoiceConnectorItem.documentation: For Amazon Chime Voice Connector groups, the Amazon Chime Voice Connectors to which to route inbound calls. Includes priority configuration settings. Limit: 3 VoiceConnectorItems per Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.

Priority.documentation: The priority associated with the Amazon Chime Voice Connector, with 1 being the highest priority. Higher priority Amazon Chime Voice Connectors are attempted first.

VoiceConnectorSettings.documentation: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector settings. Includes any Amazon S3 buckets designated for storing call detail records.

CdrBucket.documentation: The Amazon S3 bucket designated for call detail record storage.
